livre.commentaire: A literary sensation and runaway bestseller, this brilliant debut novel presents with seamless authenticity and exquisite lyricism the true confessions of one of Japan's most celebrated geisha.

Les Misérables est un roman de Victor Hugo publié en 1862. Il a donné lieu à de nombreuses adaptations, au cinéma et sur de nombreux autres supports. Dans ce roman emblématique de la littérature française qui décrit la vie de pauvres gens dans Paris et la France provinciale du xixe siècle, l'auteur s'attache plus particulièrement au destin du bagnard Jean Valjean.

livre.titre: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
livre.commentaire: Harry Potter's life is miserable. His parents are dead and he's stuck with his heartless relatives, who force him to live in a tiny closet under the stairs. But his fortune changes when he receives a letter that tells him the truth about himself: he's a wizard. A mysterious visitor rescues him from his relatives and takes him to his new home, Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

livre.titre: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

livre.commentaire: Paulo Coelho's enchanting novel has inspired a devoted following around the world. This story, dazzling in its powerful simplicity and soul-stirring wisdom, is about an Andalusian shepherd boy named Santiago who travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried near the Pyramids.

A powerful cultural touchstone of modern American literature, The Color Purple depicts the lives of African American women in early twentieth-century rural Georgia. Separated as girls, sisters Celie and Nettie sustain their loyalty to and hope in each other across time, distance and silence.

L'Homme qui rit est un roman philosophique de Victor Hugo publié en avril 1869 dont l’action se déroule dans l’Angleterre de la fin du xviie et du début du xviiie siècle. Il est notamment célèbre pour la figure mutilée dans un rire permanent de son héros qui a fortement inspiré le monde littéraire et cinématographique.

livre.titre: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
livre.commentaire: Harry Potter's summer has included the worst birthday ever, doomy warnings from a house-elf called Dobby, and rescue from the Dursleys by his friend Ron Weasley in a magical flying car! Back at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for his second year, Harry hears strange whispers echo through empty corridors and then the attacks start.

auteur.commentaire: Coelho wrote The Alchemist and published it through a small Brazilian publishing house that made an initial print run of 900 copies and decided not to reprint it. He subsequently found a bigger publishing house, and with the publication of his next book Brida, The Alchemist took off. HarperCollins decided to publish the book in 1994. Later it became an international bestseller.

Arthur Sulzberger Golden (born December 6, 1956) is an American writer. He is the author of the bestselling novel Memoirs of a Geisha (1997). Golden's most well-known novel, Memoirs of a Geisha, was written over a 6-year period; following the life of fictional Gion geisha Sayuri, the novel was re-written in its entirety three times during its development, with each re-write seeing the novel's point of view changing, before Golden eventually settled on Sayuri's perspective.

Victor Hugo est un poète, dramaturge, écrivain, romancier et dessinateur romantique français, né le 7 ventôse an X (26 février 1802) à Besançon et mort le 22 mai 1885 à Paris. Il est considéré comme l'un des plus importants écrivains de la langue française.
